title: (x) Innerzone Orchestra "Programmed" - custom {Mark S}
content:
[http://www.jpc.de/jpcimages/jpcpics/cover/front/140/1402029.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051514/http:/www.jpc.de/jpcimages/jpcpics/cover/front/140/1402029.jpg)   
   
this link goes an detroitjazz record sleeve: does anybody know the font ??   
question number two: does anybody know a font named DETROIT ??   
   
i have heard about that font today from Laurie Haycock Makela from   
o-b-o-k   
 [www.o-b-o-k.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051514/http:/www.o-b-o-k.com/)   
   
thanks in advance   
sebastian
author: ninja

comments.content: Looks like a custom job to me. Notice how the same letters look different each time they appear.

You could try NOVUM from YWFT ...   
 [http://youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=T0013](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051514/http:/youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=T0013)   
   
Or you could recreate that type style ... fairly quickly.

You asked about a font named Detroit. [Here's one](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051514/http:/2theleft.rdx.net/fontpage2.htm) (font #9).   
And [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051514/http:/freethemes.tele.net/fonts/fonts/screens/mn/newdetroitdl.htm) is one called New Detroit.

You could also take a look at Clotilde Olyff's Alpha Bloc from Font Bureau ...   
   
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/font\_frames.tpl?cart=10764384782053912&fontname=AlphaBloc](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051514/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/font_frames.tpl?cart=10764384782053912&fontname=AlphaBloc)
